alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 10:31PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wichita and eastern Greeley Counties through 1000 PM MDT/1100 PM CDT/... At 931 PM MDT/1031 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles north of Tribune to 14 miles southeast of Horace. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Wichita and eastern Greeley Counties, including the following locations... Lydia, Marienthal and Selkirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT/100 AM CDT/ for west central Kansas.
